instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3435: What is 820-3435? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green light only when battery is disconnected
threads.message:
This is an Air 11" <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>

Came in dead with no light in charger.

- When I disconnect the battery green/orange light comes up and all is working fine. (<SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> = 3.11V)
- When I connect a charged battery no light in charger but runs fine from battery. Not charging off course (<SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> = ~200mV)

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green light only when battery is disconnected
threads.message:
Can you post some voltages from <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>?
In both cases...

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green light only when battery is disconnected
[SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green light only when battery is disconnected
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 16 volts instead of 8.5v because of shorted <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR>. The light turns off because if the machine sent 16v to your 8v battery it would explode. Believe it or not <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> can go from 8 to 16 with no system damage, all downstream power rails are designed to adapt and adjust their switching frequency accordingly.

Check it!

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green light only when battery is disconnected
[SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green light only when battery is disconnected
threads.message:
2informatico: I will take some ISL measurements later

larossmann: <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 8.60V on charger and 8.45V on battery (97% charged)

aprendiz: Yes i tried with another battery

I also tried to start the machine from charger with battery disconnected and then plug the battery while running (yeah I know... but I took the chance) and then it continues running, discovers and charges the battery just fine. If I now take out the charger and plug it again then no light and no charging.

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green light only when battery is disconnected
threads.message: Replaced IO board and flex yet?

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green light only when battery is disconnected
threads.message: Yes. Same symptoms with known good IO board and flex

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green light only when battery is disconnected
threads.message: What is the resistance between pins 17/18 & pins 27/28 of <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>?

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green light only when battery is disconnected
[SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green light only when battery is disconnected
threads.message: <RESISTOR>R7180</RESISTOR> was open. Replaced and solved. Thanks guys
